record.text:
We have kids undergoing plasma exchange, when they get serious immune mediated effects… like Guillaine Barre syndrome… 

So when an infection that emerged that was novel, and worse than flu… did we really think that would not leave a dent in our kids?

It wasn’t a matter of “will kids get complications”. It was a matter of what complications, how many and for how long… 

and it looks like we actually infected them all to get the answer!!! 😡

Scientists at Yale say long COVID is part of a “long-established family of post-acute infection syndromes.” The biggest challenge is understanding its “underlying pathobiology.” They were “surprised” how often children are affected, noting kids are also vulnerable to “long-term effects.”

record.text: The "them" gives some insight into OP's mindset. Adoptees are a depersonalized other. The "we" in the rebuttal implies community and personal responsibility. But what do I know? Nuance is totally lost on me.

The pressure to be someone's only genetic connection, to fill the empty spaces affects the descendants of adoptees, too. That's a lot to expect from a baby. Adoption affects more than the adopted person. It ripples like a typhoon through generations.

record.text: The Hidden Curriculum of AI Syllabus Statements: How Fear-Based Framing Shapes Student Behaviour and Academic Integrity academicintegrity.org/aws/ICAI/pt/sh… #AI #education

images.alt:
Text Shot: Fear-based framing dulls the pedagogical opportunities AI tools can provide. Emerging research illustrates how generative AI can support personalized and scaffolded learning that aligns with constructivist theories and Vygotsgy’s Zone of Proximal Development. Studies by Kanont et al. (2024) and Zheldibayeva (2025) describe the possibilities for AI to act as a learning buddy that enhances listening, writing, and other literacy skills.

But when institutional framing casts AI as illicit, these learning supports become off-limits. This has troubling consequences for accessibility. Students with disabilities depend on AI-enhanced assistive technologies. Kuerban et al. (2025) demonstrate how specialized AI tools can provide essential support for learners with dyslexia by blending generative AI and augmented reality. Text Shot: Fear-based framing dulls the pedagogical opportunities AI tools can provide. Emerging research illustrates how generative AI can support personalized and scaffolded learning that aligns with constructivist theories and Vygotsgy’s Zone of Proximal Development. Studies by Kanont et al. (2024) and Zheldibayeva (2025) describe the possibilities for AI to act as a learning buddy that enhances listening, writing, and other literacy skills.

But when institutional framing casts AI as illicit, these learning supports become off-limits. This has troubling consequences for accessibility. images.alt: Text Shot: Does using AI make you stupid? Contrary to predictions by lay forecasters, participants randomly assigned to practice writing with access to an AI tool improved more on a writing test one day later compared to writers assigned to practice without AI -- despite exerting less effort. Likewise, whereas forecasters predicted that AI would be less helpful, and less worth paying for, than personalized feedback from experienced human editors, we found the converse: practicing with AI increased skill more than feedback from human editors (or simply googling examples and tips). The results of a third experiment suggest that AI may teach by example: writers merely shown an AI-generated cover letter (without the opportunity to practice) performed as well as writers who practiced writing with the original AI tool. Collectively, the findings of these pre-registered studies constitute an existence proof that by providing personalized, high-quality examples, AI can improve, rather than…

record.text:
这是没办法的事，虽然英伟达市值畸高但与传统泡沫也不一样。一是AI算力是真实需求，与过去人们炒作的假想需求不同。第二是这次AI牛市是低杠杆，大量投资资金并没有负债，并且用户还能通过它降本增效。第三是AI可以武器化，各大国政治家意识到了其价值，国家队下场抢夺资源。

现在最大的风险点其实是其他领域萧条。因为没有AI，一年前经济就该垮了，但是现在有了AI，在把未来透支后也会垮掉。换句话说是：本来世界已经萧条，偏偏这时出了AI。也不知道是幸运还是不幸。现在只能寄希望于在AI为市场续命期间能出现合理的产业变革。

value.text: 英伟达的市值超过了所有制药公司的市值的总和，这就是泡沫。加州经济本来很平衡，现在各个领域都被川普关税、抓移民、卡签证搞萧条，就剩技术产业一枝独秀，变畸形了。加州宪法要求政府财政必须收支平衡，下个财政年度预算根据当前收入评估，一旦出现大变动，像之前.com泡沫破了，政府就缺钱了。

record.text: 其实不光是输入法，国内相当多的软件其体验都非常优越，之所以尽量选择不用的原因是对其不信任，同时若遇到权益被其侵犯的问题，很多时候是投诉无门的。所以自然需要做出权衡与选择。

value.text: 苹果的主营业务就不是输入法，除了英语外他对其他各语言输入法都是一视同仁的不好用。只不过中文的混淆性大于其他语言，自然体验比其他语言就更差。有那么多做得很厉害的第三方输入法为什么不用？当然是由于信不过第三方了，所以转过头要求苹果把啥事都做了，最好是以后买苹果手机任何其他软件都不用装就能实现所有功能还必须都好用，不然一切责任都在苹果。

record.text:
【衝撃】75,000人が見守る中、酔っ払った選手が迎えた運命の日とは？ - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
ジョン・ウィリアムズは、かつての出来事を鮮明に覚えている。スウォンジー・シティのマネージャー、フランク・バロウズが彼のチームメイトであるジョン・フォードに近づき、彼の方向を指さしながら指示を出した瞬間だ。

この日の準備は、実際には予想外の展開を迎えていた。ウィリアムズは、ダーディントンとの試合でスウォンジーの唯一のゴールを挙げたが、試合中にプーマのブーツが壊れてしまい、代替品を手に入れる暇がなかった。

フォードの誕生日でもあったため、ウィリアムズは「祝う酒を飲まないのは失礼だ」と提案した。二人はホテルの部屋に戻ったのが午前4時で、ウィリアムズは酔い潰れていた。

目が覚めると、バスルームにいた彼は頭が痛く、フォードに急かされるままに、1992年リーグカップ決勝の日を迎えることになった。この試合は、75,000人の観衆の前で、イギリス最速のサッカー選手のタイトルを競うイベントでもあった。

1970年代から80年代にかけて、サッカーのカップ決勝のビルドアップは、単なるスポーツ報道の枠を超え、家庭を一つにする文化的な習慣として確立されていた。当時のテレビ番組は、スポーツとエンターテイメントを融合させ、独自の魅力を持つ特集を展開していたことが、多くのファンに情熱的に思い起こされている。

record.text:
【速報】ルイス・フェルナンデス、25年越しの感動再訪！サン・マメスで語る愛しい思い出とは？ - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
フランスの伝説的サッカー選手であり指導者であるルイス・フェルナンデスが、ビルバオのサン・マメスに戻り、彼の人生の中で特別な2つのチーム、アスレチック・ビルバオとパリ・サンジェルマン（PSG）の対戦を見守る。

フェルナンデスはアスレチックでの経験を振り返り、その4年間の思い出を大切にしている。アスレチックが持つ独自の文化や哲学に強く惹かれ、特に彼が手がけた時代の選手たちやファンに感謝の意を示した。

PSGについては、選手の負傷が影響しているとしつつ、ルイス・エンリケ監督がチームをうまくまとめていることを評価。「アスレチックはPSGに挑む力を持っている」とし、対戦を楽しみにしている。

また、彼は現在のキリアン・ムバッペについても称賛し、レアル・マドリードでのプレーが素晴らしいと述べた。ルイス・エンリケの指導力にも敬意を表し、彼が成功を収めていることを認めた。サン・マメスでの温かい歓迎を予想し、感激の涙を流すことを明かした。
external.title: 【速報】ルイス・フェルナンデス、25年越しの感動再訪！サン・マメスで語る愛しい思い出とは？ - AIサッカーまとめ

external.description:
フランスの伝説的サッカー選手であり指導者であるルイス・フェルナンデスが、ビルバオのサン・マメスに戻り、彼の人生の中で特別な2つのチーム、アスレチック・ビルバオとパリ・サンジェルマン（PSG）の対戦を見守る。

フェルナンデスはアスレチックでの経験を振り返り、その4年間の思い出を大切にしている。アスレチックが持つ独自の文化や哲学に強く惹かれ、特に彼が手がけた時代の選手たちやファンに感謝の意を示した。

PSGについては、選手の負傷が影響しているとしつつ、ルイス・エンリケ監督がチームをうまくまとめていることを評価。「アスレチックはPSGに挑む力を持っている」とし、対戦を楽しみにしている。

また、彼は現在のキリアン・ムバッペについても称賛し、レアル・マドリードでのプレーが素晴らしいと述べた。ルイス・エンリケの指導力にも敬意を表し、彼が成功を収めていることを認めた。サン・マメスでの温かい歓迎を予想し、感激の涙を流すことを明かした。

【重要】グアルディオラが語るXabiアロンソへの真剣アドバイス！サッカー界の衝撃再会の裏側とは？ - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
レアル・マドリードの監督として苦境に立たされているシャビ・アロンソと、彼の師でもあるペップ・グアルディオラは、サッカー界での長い物語を共有している。特に、彼らの関係は選手と監督の枠を超えたものであり、互いに切磋琢磨してきた。

グアルディオラは、アロンソに対して自分らしさを大切にし、自信を持って決断を下すようアドバイスを送っている。今週水曜日には、マドリードがバルセロナとの試合を経て急激な成績の低下を見せており、すでに選手たちと監督との間に緊張感が見え隠れしている。

アロンソは選手としてグアルディオラとの厳しい試合を経て育ち、互いに影響を与えてきた。アロンソは、バイエルンでの指導を受けて以来、サッカー理論を深く理解している一方で、現在のマドリードでも選手の責任感を強調している。選手たちは監督の指示を理解し、しっかりとしたプレーを心掛ける必要があると語る。

グアルディオラは、アロンソとの過去の経験を通じて、彼に成功を願い、再会を楽しみにしている様子が伺える。サッカーにおける人間関係や成長が、試合のプレッシャーと共に如何に重要であるかを物語っている。

external.description:
_In deafening silence, a study by Wang et al. was published, revealing the long-term effects of GMO diets on a macaque population. Dr. Guy-André Pelouze revisits this research._

## GMOs are the enfants terribles of genomics, whose fear was real in the nineties.

Experimental studies, especially human clinical trials, belong to the domain of slow thinking (Daniel Kahneman), contrary to emotional slogans filled with poor evidence or manipulated data, which trigger fast emotional thinking. One remembers in this topic the false evidence published, then retracted, then republished (1) on GMO. It appears that evidence shows that all we are seeing in this recycled paper is more due to random variation in a poorly controlled experiment than any carcinogenicity, even in rodents. It does not show that GMO corn, or Roundup, even at concentrations that no human would ever be exposed to through diet, has any effect on cancer or mortality. In this battle, one must keep one’s own strength to analyze and criticize scientific experiments instead of wasting time tilting at windmills.

Figure N°1: A timeline of events leading to the current GM crop era (2)

GMO was a trendy example of this opposition, and it is always considered in organic or fancy traditional agriculture as a danger, an evil, and the stuff of Frankenstein. Recently researchers added a piece of the puzzle, which is brilliant and should shift the debate on GMOs. Let us analyze this paper (2)

## Methodological Strengths

The study was designed with three important characteristics. Macaca fascicularis (cynomolgus macaques) is a non-human primate species. It is a well-established non-human primate model with high translational relevance to humans. That differentiates this study from several other studies based on rodents. The study followed two generations, both F0 and F1, over 7 years, a fact that is rare for GM food studies. Three groups were fed differently: CK (standard feed), Corn (70% non-GM maize), and Tg (70% GM maize). The GM maize in the diet was pondered to detect a proportional effect. Several controlled variables allow the same cultivation conditions for GM and non-GM maize (no glyphosate use), and a high-quality nutritional matching.

Data are recorded in depth about multi-omics: metagenomics (gut microbiota), metabolomics (fecal metabolites), and full hematology, hormones, and urine parameters. The technology used in this experiment is up-to-date.

**The health effects of genetically modified (GM) crops compared to their non-GM counterparts remain controversial, particularly with regard to long-term dietary exposure. **

This is partly because short-term effects are rare. That’s why opponents of GMOs turn their attention to long-term transgenerational effects, even though they don’t have strong preliminary evidence. One of the less controversial data about diet modifications is that they influence the quantity and the diversity of gut flora. The gastrointestinal microbiome is highly sensitive to dietary components and plays a critical role in host metabolism, immune function, and neurological health through the link with the brain. In addition, the diversity of the gut microbiota is increasingly considered an important marker for assessing the safety of genetically modified crops. Disruption of gut microbial populations can lead to serious health problems, including obesity, malnutrition, and diabetes. This is the reason why concerns remain about the effects of Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) on the gut microbiota. Studies have detected cryotoxin fragments in the feces of cows consuming diets containing MON810 and investigated the composition and relative abundance of fecal microbiota in Sprague-Dawley rats following a 10-week diet consisting of two GM maize strains, a homozygous maize variety, and a standard AIN93G diet. Their results indicate that non-GM and GM corn varieties resulted in an increase in the number of bacterial groups associated with carbohydrate metabolism, which could be interpreted as an adaptation to corn nutrients. However, research has also shown that broiler chickens consuming glyphosate-tolerant GM soybeans show no changes in their gut microbial populations. Similarly, pigs fed GM corn containing Bt showed no significant effect on microbial populations in their feces, ileum, or cecum. Furthermore, no discernible differences in fecal microbiota composition were observed between the control group fed non-transgenic maize and the group fed transgenic maize. This conclusion was based on an analysis of fecal microbiota composition in Wistar rats fed glyphosate-tolerant NK603 and Bt toxin MON810 transgenic maize during 6 months.

**The gut microbiome is a key indicator of health; however, studies investigating the impact of GM crop consumption on the gut microbiome remain limited.**

This study presents a comprehensive 7-year evaluation of GM maize expressing cry1Ab/cry2Aj and G10evo-EPSPS proteins through metagenomic and metabolomic analyses.

Figure N°2: this is the graphical abstract (4)

We assessed the effects of GM maize consumption on gut microbiota diversity and metabolite profiles in cynomolgus macaques (Macaca fascicularis) compared with non-GM maize. Three diet regimens were implemented: a conventional compound feed (CK group), diet formulation containing 70 % non-GM maize (Corn group), and diet formulation containing 70 % GM maize (Tg group). The results demonstrated that feeding GM maize to the first (F0) and second (F1) generations of monkeys did not substantially affect the composition, community structure, or function of the intestinal microbiome, as indicated by species composition and diversity analyses. Minor differences in intestinal metabolites were observed but were not directly linked to transgenic maize consumption. Collectively, long-term intake of maize with cry1Ab/cry2Aj and g10evo-epsps genes had no adverse effects on macaques or their offspring.

**This experimental longitudinal Study Finds No Adverse Health Effects of GM Maize in Primate Model**

Genetically modified foods have become increasingly prevalent in daily life, raising concerns about their safety and public acceptance, which in turn may influence their adoption in agricultural production.

## Key findings

About gut microbiota, there are no major differences in microbiota diversity, composition, or structure between groups. Dominant taxa remained stable across F0 and F1 (e.g., Prevotella, Bacteroidetes, and Bacillota). Minimal changes in the network structure of microbial co-occurrence.
Fecal metabolites showed significant differences in several metabolites between Tg and corn groups (e.g., mannitol, glucitol, pyridoxine, and phthalic acid). Pathway differences were observed: GM maize enriched vitamin/amino acid metabolism; non-GM maize enriched carbohydrate metabolism.
Clinical indicators are important. Blood sampling showed small decreases in mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) and platelet count (PLT) in the Tg group (F1 only). Some urine markers (e.g., protein, bilirubin) were more positive in the Tg group but not statistically significant. No significant changes in major hormone levels, liver/kidney markers, or thyroid function.

## Significance

The results of this study provide substantial evidence to support the global body of research on the safety of GM crops. While the study did not assess cellular and mucosal immunity, it establishes a methodological framework for longitudinal safety assessments of GM crops. The researchers conclude that there are no significant health risks associated with long-term consumption of GM maize.

GM maize had no significant effect on the gut microbiota of macaques. Long-term GM maize intake did not harm macaques or their offspring. This study supports the safety of GM maize feeding during 7 years in nonhuman primates.
Suggested follow-up Studies

  1. Include glyphosate-treated GM maize to reflect real agricultural use.
  2. Correlate metabolic changes to clinical outcomes (behavior, immunity, reproductive fitness).
  3. Conduct independent replications in different GM maize cultivars.
  4. Evaluate offspring fertility, cognition, and aging markers across generations.



These studies are pricey. It is possible that artificial intelligence will improve the goals of follow-up studies of GMOs.

## Overall Conclusion

This study is a landmark in GM crop safety research because it uses non-human primates, it is longitudinal (7 years) and multigenerational, and it applies state-of-the-art multi-omics tools.

It provides no compelling evidence of harm from GM maize consumption in primates, but it also does not rule out subtle metabolic alterations whose clinical significance remains uncertain.

(1) https://enveurope.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s12302-014-0014-5/comments

(2) https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/21645698.2017.1413522#d1e127

(3) https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0278691525001875?via%3Dihub

(4) https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0278691525001875?via%3Dihub

images.alt: There has never been a President that has worked as hard as me! My hours are the longest, and my results are among the best. I’ve stopped Eight Wars, saving many millions of lives in the process, created the Greatest Economy in the History of our Country, brought Business back into the United States at levels never seen before, rebuilt our Military, created the Largest Tax Cuts and Regulation Cuts, EVER, closed our open and very dangerous Southern Border, when previous Administrations were unable to do so, and created an “aura” around the United States of America that has led every Country in the World to respect us more than ever before. In addition to all of that, I go out of my way to do long, thorough, and very boring Medical Examinations at the Great Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, seen and supervised by top doctors, all of whom have given me PERFECT Marks — Some have even said they have never seen such Strong Results. I do these Tests because I owe it to our Country. In addition to the Medical, I have done something that no other President has done, on three separate occasions, the last one being recently, by taking what is known as a Cognitive Examination, something which few people would be able to do very well, including those working at The New York Times, and I ACED all three of them in front of large numbers of doctors and experts, most of whom I do not know. I have been told that few people have been able to “ace” this Examination and, in fact,

most do very poorly, which is why many other Presidents have decided not to take it at all. Despite all of this, the time and work involved, The New York Times, and some others, like to pretend that I am “slowing up,” am maybe not as sharp as I once was, or am in poor physical health, knowing that it is not true, and knowing that I work very hard, probably harder than I have ever worked before. I will know when I am “slowing up,” but it’s not now! After all of the work I have done with Medical Exams, Cognitive Exams, and everything else, I actually believe it’s seditious, perhaps even treasonous, for The New York Times, and others, to consistently do FAKE reports in order to libel and demean  “THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES.” They are true Enemies of the People, and we should do something about it. value.text:
例のアドカレ、半年前のあの本と大体やってること一緒で、誰かを非人間化すべきではないという話だな。

ちなみに非人間化とは「他者の人間性を否定して物や動物、怪物のように見なすことで攻撃のハードルを下げる心理的・社会的な現象」であって単なる擬人化とは別の概念らしいです。

『職場の「困った人」をうまく動かす心理術』（神田 裕子）装画担当者による謝罪文。

ラフ案では人間だったキャラクターを、出版社側の「みんな個性も才能もバラバラだけど必死に頑張ってる」感を出したいので動物に差し替えたいというディレクションを受けたことに配慮が足りなかったという趣旨。

一つ誤解されている気がする点として、登場人物を動物にしたことが問題なんじゃなくて、障害を抱えた労働者を動物化する一方で「定型発達の労働者を人間のままにした」こと、その非対称性が差別的で波紋を呼んでいるのだよな。定型発達者を犬か何かにしておけば問題はなかった。（しかしそれではこの本の趣旨にはそぐうまい）

record.text: 📌 Trumbull County Ransomware Incident: The Critical Role of Transparent Communication https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/16570-trumbull-county-ransomware-incident-the-critical-role-of-transparent-communication

external.description:
In November 2025, Trumbull County, Ohio, was targeted by a ransomware attack attributed to the Anubis group. Initial responses from county officials publicly denied any system compromise, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access. However, later revelations contradicted these statements, emphasizing the importance of transparency in cybersecurity incident reporting. The available information lacks technical details regarding the attack method, affected systems, or operational impact, limiting a thorough technical analysis.
This incident highlights several key considerations for cybersecurity professionals. Firstly, the discrepancy between initial denials and subsequent revelations underscores the challenges organizations face in accurately assessing and communicating the scope of a breach in its early stages. While the urgency to reassure the public is understandable, premature statements can erode trust and complicate incident response efforts.
Secondly, ransomware attacks on government entities remain a significant concern due to the potential disruption of critical services and the sensitivity of the data involved. The Anubis ransomware group, like many contemporary threat actors, likely employs a combination of encryption and data exfiltration to maximize pressure on victims.
Given the lack of specific technical details in the source material, it is not possible to analyze the attack vector or defensive measures with precision. However, the incident serves as a reminder of the importance of robust cybersecurity practices, including regular system backups, endpoint protection, and employee awareness training.
In conclusion, the Trumbull County ransomware attack underscores the ongoing threat posed by ransomware groups and the critical need for transparent, accurate communication during cybersecurity incidents. Organizations must balance the need for rapid response with the necessity of thorough investigation to ensure public trust and effective incident management.
external.title: Trumbull County Ransomware Incident: The Critical Role of Transparent Communication

record.text: 📌 Microsoft Investigates Copilot Outage Impacting European Users https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/16568-microsoft-investigates-copilot-outage-impacting-european-users

external.description:
Microsoft is currently investigating an outage affecting its Copilot service, which has left users in Europe unable to access the AI-powered assistant. According to reports from BleepingComputer, the incident began around 10:30 AM UTC on June 24, 2025. While Microsoft has not disclosed the root cause of the outage, there is no evidence to suggest that it is the result of a cyberattack or data breach.

From a technical standpoint, outages in cloud-based services like Copilot can stem from various issues, such as network connectivity problems, server failures, or software bugs. Given that Copilot relies on Microsoft's cloud infrastructure, any disruption in these services can have a significant impact on user accessibility and productivity.

The lack of specific technical details about the cause of the outage makes it challenging to assess the full scope of the issue. However, it is crucial to note that Microsoft has not indicated any compromise of user data or malicious activity. This suggests that the outage is likely due to an internal technical issue rather than an external threat.

For cybersecurity professionals, this incident underscores the importance of robust incident response plans and the need for transparency in communication during service disruptions. While outages are not uncommon in cloud services, the lack of detailed information can lead to speculation and uncertainty among users.

In terms of impact, the outage affects European users of Copilot, which could disrupt business operations that rely on the AI assistant for tasks such as coding, data analysis, and productivity enhancements. Organizations using Copilot should have contingency plans in place to mitigate the impact of such disruptions.

As Microsoft continues to investigate and resolve the issue, cybersecurity professionals should monitor updates from the company for any new information. It is also advisable to review internal protocols for handling service outages to ensure business continuity.

In conclusion, while the Copilot outage is a significant inconvenience for European users, there is no indication of a security breach at this time. The incident highlights the importance of resilience and preparedness in cloud-based services.
external.title: Microsoft Investigates Copilot Outage Impacting European Users

record.text: 📌 Firefox Phases Out 'Do Not Track' in Favor of Global Privacy Control https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/16569-firefox-phases-out-do-not-track-in-favor-of-global-privacy-control

external.description:
In a significant move reflecting the evolving landscape of online privacy, Mozilla has removed the 'Do Not Track' (DNT) feature from Firefox starting with version 135. This decision comes as many websites have historically ignored DNT requests, rendering the feature ineffective. Moreover, Mozilla has indicated that in some cases, enabling DNT could paradoxically reduce user privacy, though specific mechanisms for this are not detailed in the available information.
The 'Do Not Track' feature was introduced as a way for users to signal their preference not to be tracked by websites. However, it was never a legally binding request, and compliance was voluntary. Over time, many websites chose to ignore these signals, making the feature largely ineffectual.
Mozilla now recommends users enable the 'Tell websites not to sell or share my data' option, which is based on the Global Privacy Control (GPC) standard. GPC is a more robust framework that is gaining recognition among websites and is supported by privacy legislation in certain regions, such as the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). This shift underscores a broader industry trend towards more enforceable privacy controls.
From a technical standpoint, the removal of DNT highlights the limitations of voluntary privacy measures in an ecosystem where commercial interests often override user preferences. The adoption of GPC represents a shift towards standards that have legal backing, potentially offering users stronger protections against unwanted data collection and sharing.
For cybersecurity professionals, this change underscores the importance of staying abreast of evolving privacy standards and technologies. While GPC is not yet universally adopted, its growing recognition suggests it may become a critical component of privacy management strategies. Organizations should consider how they respond to GPC signals and ensure compliance with relevant regulations to avoid potential legal and reputational risks.
In conclusion, Mozilla's decision to phase out DNT in favor of GPC reflects a pragmatic response to the limitations of voluntary privacy measures. As the digital landscape continues to evolve, the adoption of more enforceable privacy standards will likely play an increasingly important role in shaping the future of online privacy.
external.title: Firefox Phases Out 'Do Not Track' in Favor of Global Privacy Control

record.text: The core of an AI IDE is Natural Language Processing, turning your high-level ideas into functional code snippets. It makes coding more accessible and frees up time for complex problem-solving. This is what peak productivity looks like.

Don't replace your developers with AI IDEs. Augment them. The best results come from combining human expertise with machine speed. The AI provides the spark, the developer polishes it into a functional, reliable application.

AI IDEs are streamlining the entire development lifecycle. Code generation, automated testing, and even project structure suggestions. This isn't just a gimmick; it's a fundamental shift in how we build software.

record.text: Sorry, if that sounds haughty but the "know thine enemy" approach is really important to me for having good-faith conversations with some and shutting down TechBros with others.

I want to emphasize that I'm not a doom-saying artist who condemns AI because I am fearful of it.  I understand it quite well and recognize its strengths and shortcomings.  

So when I say I hate it, I say that from the position of experience, intellect and wisdom.

I even thought about using my own voice turned into an AI model to act as backup singers for some music where I would properly sing the lead.  Quality aside, it just didn't sit well with me.  The output felt soulless and I was quickly turned off to it.

images.alt:
Travelers visiting the United States from countries like Britain, France, Germany and South Korea could soon have to undergo a review of up to five years of their social media history, according to a proposal filed on Tuesday by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

The change would affect visitors eligible for the visa waiver program, which allows people from 42 countries to travel to the United States for up to 90 days without a visa as long as they first obtain electronic travel authorization.

In a document filed on Tuesday in the Federal Register, C.B.P. said it plans to ask applicants for a long list of personal data including social media, email addresses from the last decade, and the names, birth dates, places of residence and birthplaces of parents, spouses, siblings and children.

Under the current system, applicants from visa waiver countries must enroll in the Electronic System for Travel Authorization program. They pay $40 and submit an email address, home address, phone number and emergency contact information. The authorization is good for two years.

Seraphic Chronicles – Facing the Naz’Jil: Antagonists, Tactics, and Dilemmas

The Seraphic Chronicles, particularly the episode “Screaming Into The Night” by Craig W Atkinson, introduces the Naz’Jil as a new and terrifying antagonist. This blog explores their role, the consequences of encountering…

external.description: The Seraphic Chronicles, particularly the episode “Screaming Into The Night” by Craig W Atkinson, introduces the Naz’Jil as a new and terrifying antagonist. This blog explores their role, the consequences of encountering them, and the impossible choices facing Star Command captains in the aftermath of their emergence. The Naz’Jil: Cosmic Predators The Naz’Jil are not just another alien threat—they are the stuff of legend and existential dread. Described as ancient predators, they nearly wiped out the Pyntaxian race and destroyed countless civilisations. Their mere presence induces panic, and their attacks leave victims mummified and drained, with technology rendered useless in their wake.
external.title: Seraphic Chronicles – Facing the Naz’Jil: Antagonists, Tactics, and Dilemmas

Seraphic Chronicles – Would “The Last Tears of the Banabhatta” Work with Otehr Scifi Heroes? What Makes Ejjina Unique?

Science fiction is filled with iconic captains and heroes—Picard, Kirk, Han Solo, Admiral Adama—each with their own leadership style, strengths, and flaws. But what happens if you…

external.description: Science fiction is filled with iconic captains and heroes—Picard, Kirk, Han Solo, Admiral Adama—each with their own leadership style, strengths, and flaws. But what happens if you take a story written for one protagonist and swap in another? Would the episode "The Last Tears of the Banabhatta" play out the same way if Ejjina Mexonber-Quad were replaced by one of these legends? And what, if anything, does Ejjina possess that sets her apart from these genre titans? The Core of the Episode At its heart, "The Last Tears of the Banabhatta" is a story about a starship captain haunted by trauma, facing mutiny, sabotage, and prejudice, all while struggling to reclaim a sense of belonging and authority.
external.title: Seraphic Chronicles – Would “The Last Tears of the Banabhatta” Work with Otehr Scifi Heroes? What Makes Ejjina Unique?

Haymarket in Melbourne is a great example of intersection management that crams as many cursed cars through as possible, while also slowing trams down.

2011 changes saw general traffic lanes added and lights installed. Previously, trams had priority; now, they wait for lights.

Image shows a large, multi-lane roundabout with a complex tram junction in the middle.

Compared to the preceding image, there has been an additional lane squeezed in to the roundabout at several sections, and traffic lights have been added.
